meanings.definition: To write or insert between lines.
meanings.sent1: She likes to interline her notes with colorful markers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to interline their essays for better readability.
meanings.sent3: John decided to interline his shopping list with doodles of smiley faces.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to interline the pages of his heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The artist used different colors to interline the shapes in the painting, creating a beautiful contrast.

meanings.sent1: The tailor will interline the coat to make it warmer for winter.
meanings.sent2: She decided to interline the curtains to block out more light.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would interline the aprons with feathers for a fancy touch.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to interline the sky, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The quilt was interlined with soft padding, making it extra comfortable.

meanings.definition: To transfer or copy between lines.
meanings.sent1: He had to interline the data from one spreadsheet to another.
meanings.sent2: The secretary will interline the corrections into the document before printing.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to interline the jokes from their textbook onto their notebooks.
meanings.sent4: Her memories seemed to interline the pages of her diary, capturing moments in time.
meanings.sent5: The melody interlined with the lyrics, creating a harmonious song.
